It was a three-peat for Neshannock High School Junior, Conner McBeth, who claimed his third consecutive WPIAL Champion title by winning the 50 Freestyle at the 2020 AA District 7 WPIAL Championships! As an independent swimmer, Conner swam a 20.80, his personal best 50 Free time; just missing out on the WPIAL meet record by one one hundredth of a second.

Neshannock Freshman, Bella Tinstman, placed 20th in the 200 M with a time of 2:26.27. Congratulations, Bella!

McBeth's win in the 50 Free automatically guarantees him a spot to swim the 50 Free at the 2020 PIAA AA State Swimming Championships, to held at Bucknell University, in March.

Congratulations and Best Wishes at the PIAA AA State Swimming Championships, Conner!

* * Congressman Visits NMS * *

Fifth grade students at Neshannock Memorial have been busy this year studying the ratification of the United States Constitution, as well as the formation of our federal government. We had the privilege of having Congressman Mike Kelly stop by, from Washington DC, to offer his expertise on these subjects.

Congressman Kelly shared his experiences as a legislator in the House of Representatives. He spoke to the students about the three branches of government and the Great Compromise of 1787 that established the Senate and House of Representatives within the Legislative Branch.

The students were given the opportunity to ask relevant questions to Congressman Kelly. Before the program ended, our fifth graders recited the Preamble to the Constitution, from memory, for Congressman Kelly.

Special thanks to Congressman Kelly for taking time out of his busy schedule visit Neshannock Memorial Elementary School.
Our students and teachers certainly enjoyed your visit!!

* * 2020 Prom Details * *

The Neshannock High School Prom will be held Saturday, May 2, 2020, at the Jim Beam Left Field Lounge at PNC Park.

The Grand March will begin at 5:30 pm in the NHS auditorium. Promgoers will board motor coaches at 6:30 pm for the trip to Pittsburgh. Professional photos, by Laura Ruppersberger, will begin at 7:30 pm at PNC Park. A meal, DJ, dancing, and entertainment will be provided from 8:30 pm until 12:30 am.

The motor coaches will depart for Neshannock High School at 1 am. Students will be required to travel to and from on the transportation provided.

Also, all promgoers will be required to attend the half-day of school on Friday, May 1st. Please plan accordingly as there will be no exceptions to this rule.

Additional details will follow in late-February.
